reviewText: I love this movie and if you're a fly fisherman you will too. Here's the trailer for the movie, it does a good job of whetting your appetite for the film and making you itch to get out on the river!
Great videos of beautiful river country. Only downside was watching the jetboats careening around in pristine salmon streams.
Pretty cool.
If you love fly fishing you will love this movie!

This is a real snoozefest. We thought it would feature more wild adventures, not just people fishing like regular people. It was like someone's home video. Plus I agree that the music is horrible.
The scenery is beautiful but the fish story is redundant and is more like a home video than a professional documentary,
To much talk.

Not a well developed storyline or storytelling.  I like documentaries that spur me onto looking for more of a similar nature.

This one failed on that.

Music sucks, main character is a bit of a d-bag. Also should be called Cast South central since they never go farther than a couple hours from metro Anchorage. They only fish rainbows. They talk about how awesome they are because they fly fish, bash on bait guys and then use nothing but egg patterns and flesh flies, but its cool because they tie their own.
On a positive note it is in Alaska and the cinematography is well done, so yeah lots of great scenery. Just turn the volume off and enjoy the fishing.
Great show!

Good commentary about the Alaska fishery and the people who make the great state their home. Having been up to the Kenai. Area to fly fish for trout in 2005, the depiction is accurate. It takes a special. Person to call Alaska home and the movie did a good job.

For a home-grown movie, this was a DELIGHT!  The cinematography was beautiful, the music was appropriately good, and the 1-on-1 interviews with the fishermen was most enlightening.  This was very educational, inspiring, and fun.  I recently returned from a trip on the Kenai River, and it makes me want to go back and try my luck fly fishing for trophy trout.  Best fishing movie I've ever seen!
Spectacular scenery of Alaska, but the content of the film remains the same throughout the movie.
Great fun.  I have to go to Alaska!

This movie has pretty good footage, but a terrible soundtrack. If you listened to just the music, you'd think the show is about a monster truck rally. It was very distracting and contrary to a peaceful Alaskan fishing experience.
Very well out together documentary

Beautiful scenery, well shot, but the soundtrack music was a little hokey :-). As a female who fishes, I enjoyed this basic look at trout fishing in Alaska, and fly fishing in general, as did my other half. If nothing else, I got a good case of trout envy watching it LOL. I would have liked to have seen some more in depth information on fly tying, line choice, and basic rod/reel information included--I like to know what gear people use when getting the good ones.

I did like seeing the two different types of water craft in operation as well, as we have only owned kayaks in the past (ocean going varieties designed for fishing), and my broth-in-law has a bass boat. Hopefully, Amazon prime will add more in depth fishing films to the selections over time.
Great
If you're a devoted trout-on-the-fly fisherman this is pleasant entertainment.  Recommended for a winter evening with a fire and good glass of wine.  I think you'll like it.
Great show if you love fishing.
Great Alaska fly fishing video for anyone who loves the outdoors or is an aspiring angler.
Great fishing film with good video
Great! watch it if you enjoy fishing.
Great movie!  Got to love diehards!

Great show

GREAT!

I love fishing so I may be biased when it comes to any fishing related show...

It starts off with some promise and even speaks of getting people outdoors with showing how everyone can enjoy fishing but this point quickly dwindles into annoying emo-punk rock music while attempts are made to catch rainbow trout.  Alaska has a lot more to offer when fishing on the fly and this film covers very little of the amazing species diversity present. I'm pro catch and release but this film makes you wonder if any of the participating individuals know what fish even tastes like. It's a boring film that shows little of what's really there.
Beautiful story, music, scenery and fish.  I loved seeing about Alaska trout fishing.
Kind of slow pace.

Interesting program. I almost wish there were more "episodes". Fun to watch and makes me want to at least vacation in Alaska. The only thing I don't like is that like many hunting and fishing shows, they make it look too easy. That doesn't detract from the entertainment factor though. :-)
Nice video of large rainbows caught on flies. This is not an instructional video; strictly entertainment.
Great fishing show.

I'm now convinced my quest in life should be to move to Alaska and become a fly-fisherman. What a tranquil and slightly frustrating way of life. But a life, I would love to live. This chick is a'coming Alaska. Great film.
Great video.

Great little flick, minus one star for the music, better scores in 1970's porn films. Other than the music selection, wonderful. And guys that are wanting to get your girls out there with you, have them watch this. All around a good film explaining why we fish... Fun!
Way too self-indulgent.  Nice trout porn, but a "quest for a 30-inch rainbow?"  C'mon.  It's Alaska.  Just throw an egg fly at a Dolly Varden and have fun.  Sheesh.
Terrific landscape/country, fishing film.
Excellent cinematography choreographed with great "interviews".
Great show on the endeavor to catch a trophy rainbow.
I enoyed it a lot
Great!  Enjoyed every minute of it.
I love fishing but the movie had poor lighting and just became boring. I guess I can't watch others fish.
Not quite up to my taste

I thoroughly enjoyed watching this film. There was mention that it was only of Rainbow trout and I actually thought that was special because these fishers a unique breed in Alaska. It reminded me why I went on a trip to Kodiak Alaska from Vermont. The amazing fishing(silver salmon run), the animals,the wonderful people and the scenery. I would recommend this to everyone, fly-fisher or not. Great job
A fun series of related fishing trips with excellent scenery and sincere characters. It would be great to be in the film with them!!
my wife and I both enjoy watching it.  these guys have a lot of fun on the show and they seem to be people you wouldn't mind spending time with.  Would love to go fishing with Dave & Bobbi
A lot of Rainbow Trout action from a variety of search methods.  The scenery is wonderful and these anglers are passionate about their sport.
Very Very good movie, Only feature Rainbow's but it covers all water conditions and is a must for stream fly fishers. It is the fastest playing movie and the end is a monster of a fish.
I only wish that other species could have been included.  It was interesting, but I am wondering if they ever eat any fish they catch?

I liked this film because as a chick and a non-fisher I actually saw what people like about fishing. It was beautiful scenery and nice to see a woman's perspective too. I'd recommend this to any outdoorsy type, male or female, fisherman or not that just wants to experience some of the great outdoors from the comfort of their living room. :)
This is one of the most beautiful fishing documentaries I've ever seen and I actually booked a trip to Alaska in part because of it.  Trophy rainbow await!

I live in Alaska and watching this reminds me of why.  Some great scenery and they do a good job of keeping true to the state, which is nice as a lot of the reality TV that's out there just doesn't do it justice.  I'd recommend this to anyone who loves fishing, Alaska or the great outdoors.  Sometimes it's easy to get caught up in the daily grind of things, this one really inspires me to get out there in the wilderness and breathe.

My boyfriend and I really like this movie.  We watch a lot of fish porn and this was had a lot of great fish!
Watch it, enjoy it, and watch it again.
Very good & informative video,great fishing shots,great information on the how comes,& why they made the video,loved the outdoor shots.

This superbly filmed and edited movie depicts rainbow trout fly fishing as it's done on the Kenai River and a smaller river in the Mat-Su area of Alaska. Although anglers not familiar with this kind of fishing might pick up a tip or two about indicator fishing with beads (egg patterns) and flesh flies, this film isn't about how the fish are being caught. Rather, it's about why people fish. To this end, the most compelling segment of the film is the opening story featuring husband and wife Dave and Bobbie Holsman, avid anglers whose fishing lifestyle allows them to build and share a reservoir of experiences and memories. Other stories in the film feature Dave Holsman teaming up with angling friends to pursue the fish of a lifetime: an elusive 30" Kenai River rainbow. These are stories that will resonate with most anglers--and the cinematography, complete with soaring eagles, swans, bears, moose, big trout and lovely water filmed under autumn skies is sure to give viewers an itch to come and explore this great state. But there's an underlying problem with the subject itself. On both river systems, a number of otherwise beautiful trout that come to net have seriously damaged jaws--the result, no doubt, of fish being caught multiple times on barbed hooks and carelessly released. Happily, Holsman addresses this problem. Hopefully, more anglers will use small, barbless hooks when fishing for trout they don't intend to keep in the first place. This is a good film to watch on a cold winter day while dreaming of warm weather, new water and arced rods.
Great shots of Alaska!

i was drawn in by the title. but it soon left me wondering if this was about fishing or some dude that wanted to come clean to his girlfriend he really didn't want to spend time with her. either way not worth the brain cells only my thought

Decent flick. The soundtrack is painful however. Imagine a 40-50 year old guy/gal catching the fish of a lifetime to the tune of a pop punk guy wining about his high school girlfriend. It's kind of silly but it ruined the movie for me. I was constantly cringing waiting for the next blast of pop punk in my face. About half-way through I turned it off.
Not much recent video available on Alaska fishing but this is a keeper. Enjoyed it so much that I watched it twice. I'm headed to the Kenai in July 2018, can't wait. Thanks for a great film!
for the fishing fanatic
Highly recommend
Can watch it again and again.

Beautifully done all the way - so nice to also see rainbow trout fishing highlighted and not the usual salmon.
And of course, you can't beat that scenery.  Very enjoyable.  And like they said in the credits, thanks to the fish!!!!
great fun
